Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stewart H
Reviews.Content: Had booked this hotel due to it's close proximity to the Railway station (returning to UK on Orient Express!), so didn't want to travel too far when we booked out. Went for a Superior room (3rd floor), overlooking the Grand Canal - the view was wonderful. However, locals can be a bit noisy during the night, as we found out whilst trying to sleep. The hotel is well situated for road, rail, and water bus links. There are some wonderful restaurants in the area too, although during our visit, there was some building work taking place next door, but this did not affect us at all during our stay. Breakfast was plentiful, and set us up for the day. The room was very clean, presentable, and a joy to stop in, and yes I would stay there again, but hope the locals might be a little quieter next time.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction - hope it doesn't lose it's charm”
Reviews.Author: Ken R
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights (Apr1-3/12). Chose hotel based on easy access on arrival. Thankfully plans changed and we arrived by bus rather than car. Bus and train access are great. Arriving by car is a challenge due to current construction. Hotel website should indicate that expansion construction has created some challenges for car parking & outside patio. Had a problem with our first room but staff moved us up one floor which resolved the issue. Suspect problem will continue during construction phase but given the age of the building - we don't have buildings that old in North America - it's to be expected. Some of the front desk staff could be more helpful to guests, although the older gentleman working on Sunday and Monday was quite friendly and helpful. He advised us of a free water taxi ride to a Murano glass factory demo - great outing! Continental breakfast was adequate and breakfast room bright and cheery. Canal noise may bother light sleepers however, if you've come to experience Venice it's part of the package. Alternatively, don't ask for a "canal view". WIFi didn't work on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clay L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights, and it was great! Loved how much character the hotel had. Construction was happening to expand, but it didn't affect our stay at all. Comfortable bed, and the continental breakfast was great! Also, it's right next to the bus and train stations, which I had originally been nervous about. Not to worry! They're far enough away that we never noticed any noise/smog, and when we left, it was extremely helpful to not have to carry our luggage through the winding corridors of Venice to make our train. I'd definitely stay at Santa Chiara again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bruz97
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel which was part of a tour that we purchased from go-today.com. The hotel is overlooking the Grand Canal and has easy access to the Vaporetto and the train station. The location was ideal. Our room was located in the Annex building. At first I was disappointed that we were not staying in the main building but realizing there was construction directly next to the main hotel we were glad we stayed in the Annex building. Our room was located on the first floor. We had patio doors which let outside into a courtyard which was not very private or secluded. We never opened the drapes which made the room very dark. The mattress was very uncomfortable but the room was clean. The bathroom was huge.The breakfast was delicious and the waiter service was great. There is a co-op supermarket a few doors down from the hotel which is very convenient. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “annex versus main hotel”
Reviews.Author: cros831
Reviews.Content: The Santa Chiara is in a great location - particularly if you take the number 5 bus from the airport as it stops right behind it - the Venice connected Vaporetto card is great value and needed for this hotel and the stops are right outside on the Grand Canal. We were staying in the annex down the street and had a great family room which was spacious enough for 4 people. The room was a bit dark as only half the bulbs were working in the light fitting and the air conditioning wasn't switched on as I was told it had been cold last week (well it wasn't this week and being in the top of the building it was quite stuffy!) I must say I am glad we were in the annex, as it was very quiet and the main hotel is having a new extension built which currently involves building works around two sides of the hotel and when they were driving the pilings into the ground it made the hotel shake at breakfast! Breakfast is continental and tasty with a decent choice. Staff were helpful and courteous There is a great supermarket just past the Vaporetto stops to stock up on drinks

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel, Super Staff, Super Everything”
Reviews.Author: Stuart T
Reviews.Content: Located right next to the Grand Canal and a minutes walk from the bus station it couldn't be better located particularly if you like zooming about on the waterbus [Vaporetto] with the locals. The staff were very helpful and our room, which overlooked the canal , was very comfortable and brilliant for watching all the boats coming and going particularly in the morning. Breakfast was great and the dining room is feet from the canal so you can watch Venice waking up and getting ready for another busy day. If you go pre book your vaporetto tickets [and museums, WC's etc] via Venice Connected online you save a fortune and you can go to Murano, Burano and Lido on the ticket [if you book the right one], jumping on and off as often as you want. Venetians are very friendly and funny, watch for 'white van man' in his boat shouting insults to his mates on other boats and walk out to all the districts [they all seem safe] where it goes very quiet and cheap! In the afternoon/evening go for 'chichetti' it's like tapas but venetian. On a canal opposite a gondola repair yard [Fondamenta Nani ?2mins from Zattere vaporetto stop] in Academia district there are two bars, one's a wine shop and they are both great fun, the food very different and cheap. I loved the whole trip and I wish I was you thinking about going because I've got to work on Monday in the midlands of the UK. Santa Chiara thankyou for making it affordable and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: First rate hotel. Very comfortable room. Wide range of choices for breakfast. Helpful staff and good service. Perfectly situated close to bus station, rail station and overlooking Grand Canal. Great value. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Squarehead01
Reviews.Content: The Santa Chiara Hotel is in a fantastic location. Other hotels in Venice may require you to take an expensive 'Vaporetto' and perhaps pay for porters, not the Santa Chiara. As other reviews have stated, take the Airport Express bus from outside Marco Polo Airport arrivals and 20 minutes later, it drops you off at the Piazza Roma, from there it is a 3 minutes walk to the hotel. The airport express cost 5 Euros for a single journey, or buy a return ticket for 9 Euros. My wife and I visited late February and were in Venice for the last couple of days of the carnival, it was very crowded, but still breathtaking. Unlike some other reviews, we found the receptionists to be extremely helpful and polite. Our room was very warm, as February evenings remain very chilly. The hotel is located on the west side of Venice, perfectly located for water taxis, trains, buses and for walking. Walking is the best way to see Venice, ensure you have comfortable shoes and a decent map, we were given one by the (unhelpful!!) receptionist at the hotel when we checked in. We were also given another map by the (Unfriendly !!) receptionist when our original became a bit 'worn'. Even with a decent map, you will get lost, but its quite enjoyable attempting to find your way back! Another excellent way to see Venice is via the Grand Canal, 6.50 Euros buys you a Vaporetto ticket for one stop, or 10 stops, take the No1 Vaporetto from Piazza Roma to San Marco, one end of the Grand Canal to the other....amazing. Buy a 16 Euro, 12 hour Vaporetto ticket for great flexibility for as many journeys as you wish, just remember to Validate your ticket! My wife and I spent a day in Verona....another breathtaking city. Again the Santa Chiara receptionist surpassed themselves by assisting me in train times and printing them for me, they also helped me with my Italian language skills to ensure I purchased a 'return' ticket. To complete this review I would like to thank all the Santa Chiara staff for making our stay in Venice a memorable occasion, our room was cosy and inviting. The breakfast is continental, exactly as described, and the entire hotel was immaculate. Santa Chiara Hotel staff......I thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Receptionists”
Reviews.Author: Gamse79
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not standart some room have haÄ±r dryer some dont. Staff is so arrogant. Breakfast tables are dirty even plates are dirty. Airconditining is not working propperly. The rooms vere so cold in February ( Carnival Time)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELCHICK48
Reviews.Content: The Santa Chiara is really quite charming, the location could not be better. We stepped off the plane with hand luggage only and were in the hotel in 45 minutes. The No5 bus from the airport takes you to Piazza Roma, as soon as you pull into the bus station you can see signs for the hotel no problems trying to find your hotel down winding alleys! The Vaporetto stop is a mere minute away with access to all the sites. We walked all the way to St Marks on the first day and it really is not far if you don't want to invest in the Vaporetto tickets. We had an issue with noise after our first night, more to do with noisey guests than the hotel and were swiftly moved the next day to a room on the second floor, which had an inner door which successfully soundproofed us from any further disturbances. Beds are a little firm for our liking, but did not stop us from sleeping after a full on day sightseeing. The hotel was a warm respite from the bitter February weather in Venice, each day we actually returned to the hotel at some point to recharge cameras and have a warm up. Management were always courteous and friendly whenever you presented yourself at reception. Breakfasts were plentiful and delicious. Only used the bar once because they had no ice available for the drinks, given the freezing weather conditions perhaps they thought nobody would want ice in their drinks? All in all I would say this was an excellent place to stay in a city where you really can spend a fortune just for the view which can be enjoyed by everyone for free just by taking a stroll along by the lido.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: pgwswth
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice for a reasonably priced hotel in the centre of Venice. A very adequate cold buffet breakfast is included although I do wish Italian hotels would serve their wonderful real coffee at breakfast - what we got tasted like instant but was OK. Maybe not the most picturesque setting although it is on the Grand Canal - the bus station is behind and straight ahead is a modern bridge leading to a newish office block and the railway station but look right and you get a more traditional view down the canal. Slight traffic noise but nothing to worry about. Free wi-fi in the reception area. The main hotel is an old building, nicely decorated. We were in the annex which is a good 200m away down a short alley. No views but the room and bathroom were very large, neatly but quite sparsely furnished. A setee or a couple of comfy chairs would have been nice but really it was a pleasant room and was kept very clean. Bathroom was a wet room and kitted out for diabled visitors. Fridge and safe were provided but bring your own travel kettle if you want a brew. The staff were helpful and pleasant. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: greenrosedave
Reviews.Content: Had a recent two night pre-cruise. Staff is wonderferful. Clean and comfortable rooms, very nice typical Italian Continental Breakfast. Steps to the vaperetto and airport shuttle bus and train station. Luggage can be a promlem at odther Venice Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best location if you fly or drive to venice....”
Reviews.Author: ritzstar
Reviews.Content: never mind if it was an old building or it was a monastery before it is a hotel. the building is conveniently located just beside a bus interchange. if you fly o drive to venice, this hotel is just for you.when you got into marco polo airport, you can just purchase the bus ticket at the arrival hall.no booking required unlike the water taxi or buses. you ll get to the hotel in half an hour journey from the airport.the bus will terminate its service at the last stop which is located just next to the hotel. there is also a ferry stop just five minute away from the hotel to get you the other part of venice. when you travelling with big luggage and small chilfren tagging along, this hotel is just for you.

Reviews.Title: “love the canal view”
Reviews.Author: irishwhiskey1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at this hotel. Rooms were on the small size but very happy. my husband and I had a canal view room and our son's had a smaller room across the hall. Beds. were ok. the rooms were very very clean and nicely furnished. The decor fit the building perfectly. Loved being able to look out our window and watch what was going on on the canal. The hotel does not have parking on site at this time because they are under construction so you have to park across the street and lug your luggage to the hotel. My husband was very thankful that I didn't get a hotel towards the middle of Venice. We had been traveling Munich, and Austria so heavier clothes, heavier suitcases. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and very pleasant. We enjoyed our breakfast that came with our room reservation. No one left hungry from our table. Very very nice experience. Water Taxis and Water Bus very very near the hotel so easy to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - and cheap - by Venetian standards!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBridge
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here after our cruise last October. The location is fantastic, very close to the Piazza Roma and you could get to the hotel with minimal stairs to navigate. Breakfast was adequate. Rooms were clean - we were 3 in one room so a bit crowded, but fine. Given the price, we could not complain. Lifts were small, but they did the job. Good location and value for money - in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Continental grandeur on a budget”
Reviews.Author: lone-opine
Reviews.Content: Santa Chiara looks beautiful, as ancient as the other buildings in Venice it has ochre coloured walls which were lit by sunlight as I made the (very short) journey from the train station. Inside there are marble floors and mahogany furniture in the guest rooms. A swift, modern lift took me to the third floor where my room was located at the side of a mirrored foyer. The room was small and dark and the single bed was extremily narrow. However it was really comfortable despite the monastic appearance and the adjacent bathroom was well equipped with the continental delight of a bidet included. The shower was a little dodgy. Inside the cubicle there was an alarm cord - presumably to alert if the water gets to scalding point. I pulled it by accident but nothing happened. I had a stunning view of the Grand Canal. The breakfast buffet was ample and tasty - get up early to enjoy warm boiled eggs. Transport links to this budget hotel are excellent - buses, trains, water buses are all within 5 minutes and the hotel has its own taxi boat parked outside.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Chiara - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JoyfulWriter
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel, most especially because of its location -- the Plaza Roma. Unless you don't mind spending a fortune on a water taxi, or you don't mind pulling your suitcase up and down cobbled lanes and over bridges to another hotel, this is the place to stay. The hotel is directly beside the bus stop that takes you across the bridge to the mainland (and the airport). It's the only place in Venice where there are motorized vehicles. It's also beside the main station for the water buses that ply the waterways through the city. And, also very close to the train terminal. It was the absolute best location I could imagine in Venice. The morning we needed to leave to go to the airport, we walked out of the hotel, across the sidewalk and onto the Blue Bus that leaves about every 20-30 minutes and costs 5 euro per person. It took about 30 minutes for the non-stop ride to the airport. Be sure you find the bus that goes directly there without extra stops. The hotel is also convenient to those going to and from a cruise ship. We did have to pull our luggage through the port area, but just outside the port is an overhead tram (they call a "people mover") that takes you directly to the plaza where the hotel is located. It cost 1 euro per person for the trip from port to plaza and was only about a 3 minute ride. You might think being so close to all this transportation would make the hotel a noisy place to stay. We didn't have any problem. We were on the second floor, overlooking a side canal and the room was just fine. I read where you should ask for a room in the "main" hotel, which I did. I didn't notice where the annex building was (I'd read that it is a bit further away), but we were happy with our hotel situation. Plus, the room was not expensive by European standards. For the middle of November, we paid a total of 90.50 euros per night and that included a fairly decent buffet breakfast, which is always a big plus. The room we had was a decent size and the bathroom was good as well. The TV even had an English-speaking station (British news station), which was a treat after a week in Rome with no English TV at all. The bed was too firm for my taste, but my husband had no problem with it, and we made out for three nights. The hotel has charming features as, I believe, it was once a private home, built several hundred years ago. If I ever return to Venice, I would definitely choose to stay at the Hotel Santa Chiara.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Cruise Pax”
Reviews.Author: Bob R
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated on Piazzale Roma, which is the last place that Motor transport can go in Venice, so good transport links to the Airport and Cruise Terminals as well as walking distance to the Railway Station. The Front of the Hotel It is situated on the Grand Canal and it is possible to walk to all the major tourist sites or take the Vaporettos from very close by. Needless to say that the Hotel is very old and the decor is a little bit dowdy, I had a single room and it was just that,small with a single bed and en suite bathroom but no complaints about the cleanliness, the staff were helpful and spoke English and the Breakfast was typically Continental. Overall for the money it was adequate for an overnight stay but if you are there for any length of time and like to stay in your room then this may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: murphy963
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money. Pleasant staff and very helpful. Been there three times and looking forward for the fouth.

Reviews.Title: “good acomodation and sevices.”
Reviews.Author: pablo f
Reviews.Content: in general the acomodation is really good .. some little details but happy to be there :-).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Michele N
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our stay! At first we were concerned when we learned we were staying at the Annex, Residenza Parisi, but soon realized we prefered staying there. The room was very clean and large, the bathroom was tremendous and being next door to a market was extremely convenient for stocking up our mini fridge. The towel warmer in the bathroom was a nice added bonus! Breakfast was served in the main building, but it was only a 2 minute walk. The location couldn't be beat for convenience --- Just steps outside the door was a convenient vapporetto stop, across the bridge was the train station, and you are staring at the hotel when you step off the People Mover from the port. I am so happy we didn't have to tote our luggage on boats, over bridges, and throughout countless narrow city streets like so many other people. In fact, it's the only area in the city where you can catch land-based travel to the airport (such as buses or taxis). The only criticism about the hotel is that the mattress was in need of replacing. We also found these things odd, but believe it to be a "European thing": the only place to store your clothes was in a closet with a rod and few shelves and the shower didn't have an enclosure such as glass or a curtain. These were quirky, minor inconveniences and would absolutely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “just the business!!”
Reviews.Author: WHITESEA
Reviews.Content: stayed a couple of nights at the end of March 2011 - asked for a room with a view of the Grand Canal and got it, superb, beautiful room, excellent furnishings and ambience throughout. Position of hotel perfect, parked at the tronchetto and got the people carrier to Piazzale Roma and its just there and on the Vaporetti stop, within easy reach of everything, just loved it would stay there again for sure. Breakfast a little disappointing but adequate and staff well a little aloof but ok - courteous and efficient. Venice has to be the most beautiful city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Venice stay at Santa Chiara - November 2011”
Reviews.Author: John_in_Georgia
Reviews.Content: What a great old hotel. Situated in the heart of everything in Venice. A beautiful establishment with a suprisingly good breakfast, big clean rooms, and interent access. On the Grand Canal at the Pizzale Roma Vaporetta stop, close to the Santa Lucia train station. You couldn't ask for more conveinience yet the rooms were quiet and comfortable. Nice, friendly and helpful staff. Loved it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Knowledgeable staff, walking distance to train station, nice views”
Reviews.Author: Girly-Avanter
Reviews.Content: Great little family owned hotel in perfect proximity to trains, taxi, ports. Generally clean rooms (carpets were a bit dirty) firm beds and bathrooms have decent sized shower. Good breakfast included in room price. Great view of the canal through a porthole window in the room. Only drawback, in off season, airconditioning is turned off in rooms and you sweat it out all night as there are no screens to keep bugs out if you open windows. A couple of engligh TV channels and front desk staff are very knowledgeable and speak excellent english and will provide honest guidance on best options for visitors not looking to overspend on tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “We will return....again!”
Reviews.Author: melchior1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Chiara the last time we were in Venice about 10 years ago. It was so great we decided to return, and we weren't disappointed! This hotel has a perfect location - close to the vaporetto stop, train station, supermarket, restaurants and shops and about 25 minutes by vaporetto from Piazza San Marco. The breakfast is very generous and varied and the service is excellent. We enjoyed breakfast looking out on the boats passing by - really relaxing! We had a lovely large comfortable room in the annex of the hotel with a big bathroom - very cosy! We will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Just not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: JulieBWatfordUK
Reviews.Content: We booked the top floor room at 350 euros a night, but really felt that, apart from the view, the price was unjustified. The receptionist did not smile once. The porter was delightful, as was the lad who replenished breakfast items, and the chambermaid, but they seemed to be the only ones with a desire to give good service; certainly not the reception staff. The area and location are very good which is one reason we chose it. On the plus side, the decor was good, and it was quiet. The view was magnificent. On the minus side, well, here's our list: *powerpoints fell out of the wall as we pulled plugs out *missing button on tap *chips and scratches in bath *low water pressure *discoloured and rusting bathroom fitments *chimney smoke on our 'luxury' terrace *needs decent fan in internal bathroom * Insect screen needed against mosquitoes *breakfast crockery not well washed This was my Australian cousin's holiday of a lifetime, and we were very disappointed. I have been to Venice several times, and have always had a more positive experience. I am sad to write such a negative review. As you can see, and as others have written, most problems are with the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “The Chiara has a lot going for it.”
Reviews.Author: cmd123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise out of Venice in October 2011. It's front entrance faces the Piazza Roma--a big hub of bus transportation form the airport. The rear entrance faces the Grand Canal. It's in Santa Croce, a very nice area of Venice that is out of the crazy crowded areas around St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. We found lots of tempting restaurants and had one of our best meals at a small local place we found on one of our walks. A vaporetto stop is practically right out the back door. In addition to the hotel, there is an annex a short walk away along the canal. We stayed in the annex. The room was gigantic, with all the amenities you would expect from a nice hotel. The bathroom was huge and spotless. For those not familiar with Italian door keys and lights, you open the door with the key, then insert it in a plug inside the room, and then have power for the ilghts, etc. Breakfast was very pleasant, in a beautifully deocrated room facing the Grand Canal. Since a lot of their clientelle seems to be coming or going to a cruise, they are used to holding luggage before checkin and checkout. There is a computer available for guests, as well as wi-fi if you have your own laptop. All in all, we had no complaints and would definitely recommend this hotel to friends travelling to Venice, whether for a cruise or just to enjoy Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms - close to all public transport!”
Reviews.Author: wendyL25
Reviews.Content: The Santa Chiara hotel was in an amazing location - perfect for being dropped off in Venice by the airport bus! It was close to the water bus stop that takes you around the grand canal to all the major sites. The cruise ship port was only 5 minutes by taxi. It was also close to some reasonable restaurants and market stalls. Rialto bridge and Piazza San Marco were only a short walk away (about 10 - 20 minutes if you walk slowly). The rooms were very comfortable, complete with a chandelier and my room had a nice view over the canal. Even though my room overlooked Piazzale Roma (the main bus station/transport hub for Venice) it was very quiet. Would highly recommend this hotel for travellers only staying for a few days or who are going on a cruise from venice.

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: lonnyliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Chiara in May 2011, and would recommend this place to our friends. We were given accommodation for disabled, even though this was not needed for us. However, this gave us a spacious room, with huge bathroom, all spotlessly clean. Even though we were near the bus and train stations, and water taxi, our room was very quiet. It was in an ideal location for us as we arrived by train, and departed by bus, which saved us having to drag suitcases very far. Breakfast was great and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: BroomeAussies
Reviews.Content: The Santa Chiara Hotel is definitely the best located hotel if you are arriving by train & departing on a cruise ship. Simply exit the railway station, turn right walk 200m, over a bridge and there it is on your left. You may need to rest at the top of the bridge dpending on you suitcase size but it is not a long or difficult walk. The hotel is ageing a little but so is Venice. It is all part of the wonderful experience. The staff are first class throught from reception, dining and room cleaners. They certainly go out of their way to make you welcome and help with every inquiry. The breakfast is probably the best in any small hotel anywhere in Europe it is both excellent in selection and quantity. The rooms are a bit smaller than newer hotels and yes the bathrooms are not big but that is character of the place. When going to the shipping terminals grab a cab at the door of the hotel it only costs 15Euro. The ease of transfer makes it money well spent. This hotel is recommended to all travellers single, couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Peterbaillie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a family in separate rooms, both of which were good. The hotel was booked by us primarily because of its suitability for the disabled (I am disabled, a very slow walker and needed the disabled-suitable bathroom which proved to be fine. The shower is designed to be operated without the need for a shower curtain, (it's not missing, as was suggested by a previous reviewer. It's my understanding all the rooms in the Parisi are disabled-suitable. It may be annoying for some to have facilities easy enough for fully able use but not needed, though I can't see that as a problem). Having read previous reviews, we knew it was a separate building from the Santa Chiara, so that was not a surprise. We were relieved to find they had not exaggerated about its location, in fact you would be hard pressed to find a better location - It's within a short walk (right on the edge) of the Piazzale Roma, where the shuttle bus (5 euros) arrives from Marco Polo airport and just over the new grand canal bridge is the station area - Piazzale roma is effectively the transport interchange for Venice - for vaporetti, coaches, cars and trains (the Santa Chiari and Parisi are the only hotels in central Venice which can be reached by car). It all sounds convenient but maybe not too attractive, which did concern me before we got there and in reality, nobody would want to send home postcards of the square itself. However,though they may exist in a modern environment, both the Santa Chiara and the Parisi face onto the grand canal and sit right on the canal bank. It's a lively environment all during the day and evening. The first stop on the number 1 vaporetto route is very close, almost to the extent of feeling like a private vaporetto station for the hotel ( the stop is callled Piazzale Roma Parisi). Even with my walking difficulty, I sometimes opened the French windows and took the short stroll down the pleasant private lane to watch life going on at the vaporetto terminal. Being at the start of the route is a big advantage for getting on the vaporetto and after an inevitably tiring day exploring Venice, being able to get off again within yards of our hotel room was fantastic. All staff were pleasant and helpful (at reception they spoke perfect English) and both rooms were attractive and clean, the beds comfortable and clean. The bathroom was unusually large. I was surprised at a previous comment that the walk to the Santa Chiara for breakfast was far too long. For a normal walker I'd say it is not far at all, (though of course for somebody who has wallking difficulty and depending on the indivdual, it might be felt a long way). We were fortunate to have great weather and that made it a pleasant stroll, which I could manage. Within a few yards of the front door are a good a good little 'supermerkato', bank, cash machine and post office and there are good places to eat in the area. Although I can fully understand that visitors ravelling to Venice might prefer to stay in a more romantic ancient building - and the Parisi is undeniably a modern building, the advantage of having facilities that work properly outweighed the lack of history and the convenience for travelling around Venice allows you to see more of what you went there for. I've rated the children activities 'terrible' because I wasn't aware of any activities, or indeed any children, in either the Chiara or Parisi but really I would have preferred a 'not applicable' option, as our children are all young adults. Very difficult to know if value was good or average compared to other hotels, so settled on average. Overall, I washovering between very good and excellent, settling on very good, though actually I can't offer up a real negative and certainly, we would go back. .

Reviews.Title: “Good Location But Tired”
Reviews.Author: serenity133
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and the location is superb however the hotel is tired and in need of refurbishment. We had a superior double room number 3003 on the 3rd floor, the furnishings were poor and the room was poorly lit and dowdy. The bathroom was not in good condition and the shower head was almost totally blocked and had to be replaced at our request. We had to wait on two occasions for tables to be cleared for breakfast and had to seek out the waiter for this to happen. The hotel was clean On the basis of the hotel condition and the quality of superior room 3003, we considered it to be overpriced at 478 euros for two nights, including buffet breakfast, compared to similar hotels in the area which we have used in the past, the big plus is the location as it is the only hotel on the Grand Canal accessible by road.

Reviews.Title: “Santa Chiara Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Carole21_11
Reviews.Content: It is a good location, especially if arriving via rail or ship. The staff are helpful. The venue is tired and in need of being updated, especially the bathroom. It is clean.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: SDS72611
Reviews.Content: well located, great staff and nice rooms. the hotel overlooks the water and the views are quite good. Overall a great place to go to and get a good break. The staff are friendly and assist all guests to ensure they have a good time

Reviews.Title: “Best I can say is.. handy if you're coming off the cruiseship.. !?”
Reviews.Author: veegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2011 on our honeymoon. We had just finished a cruise and only stayed here 1 night before heading home. Only 2 good thing you can say about the place is that its right beside the bus station (for getting to the airport/getting off the cruiseship buses) and that the staff are very helpful. The location itself is a little bit far from the main Venice attractions.. you'd want to get the water buses to the main sites as takes over half hour to work to main centre of Venice. The outside of the hotel is horrible - orange and blue.. nice.. ! The inside is ok.. the rooms are really dusty and gloomy, could do with a lick of paint but as I've been in Venice before I knew the style to expect. I dont remember what breakfast was like.. which says a lot.. as I normally do remember !

Reviews.Title: “A great location...a busy hotel........middle of the road...clean”
Reviews.Author: Willowhisper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during August and it was booked by our cruise agent. It was average and acceptable though nothing dramaticallly impressive other than it's splendid location on the Gran Canal...The reception was modern and the staff were stiff though polite and 'busy' (as they always are when meeting foreigners). Still all in all areasonably pleasnt experience. The room we had was a triple (double with an extra bed) on the top floor. Very dark brown colours and dark shutters obviously against the heat. The beds were very comfortable and the en suit shower/toilet was very modern except the shower head. Everything was in dark red, which was a bit surprising. The rooms because of the dark colours look a bit dowdy, but still not shabby. Breakfast was acceptable though they were very under staffed, with only one man doing everything in a packed dinning room in August..poor guy I felt very sorry for him.he was doing his best though. It was a pretty room with pink table cloths. The all over impression was a clean, well located average hotel with everything the average family or couple would need though not 'exceptional'. We arrived early and were allowed to sit in the luggage room until the room was ready.. which they made an effort to get cleaned as soon as possible. They have a very small but nice bar. Value for money...? It's was what you would expect to pay in Venice in the high season..Venice being very famous very being very expensive. We stayed one night because we met people on our cruise who showed us another hotel they were staying in for the same price that was really a lot more modern and really fabulous and we got a very good deal, but if we hadn't found the other place, we would have been quite happy to stay at this hotel for the duration of our stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MarieJirousek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Santa Chiara for 5 nights in august, and despite the very busy traffic outside, I enjoyed the calm of the place. The decor is stylish and the room was very clean. There were a few things that bothered me...the room had a great flat screen TV with hundreds f channels - none of them in any other language than italian! Come on, this is supposed to be for tourists from all around the world, and I couldn't even get the international news! I know it can't be a reception problem, because I stayed at a hotel near the station 2 years ago and THEY had english and french speaking channnel. So, TV was out. Also, I don't quite understand the purpose of a mini-bar in the room, that keeps all the drinks at room temperature (but that appears to be a problem everywhere in Venice, they don't seem to know what "cold drink" means). The staff was helpful and friendly enough (though like someone else mentionned here, the elderly gentleman at the reception WAS a bit grumpy some days), but there must have been some kind of an organisation problem, because twice I ordered breakfast in my room and never received it. On the last day there, I had breakfast downstairs and was pleasantly surprised: there was a large choice of food, and quite enough of it. So my general impression is rather positive, it may not have been perfect but it was pleasant enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great view at Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Zuccero
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is ideal especially is you arrive with a car in Venice. Although when we arrived at Venice the hotel's private parking wasn't available due to some restoration works that were carried out, accross the street there is a large parking facility. The location is excellent with easy access to vaporetto and the room given to us had a great view at the Grand Canal. The room was nice with the only negative being the small bathroom and especially the shower which had some issues (no stable hot water, didn't drain well). Also there was not enough supplies of bath assesories.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: babybellecat
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with charming staff and in an ideal location,It is 5 mins from the main train station, at the entrance to the port and bus station on one side and straight into Venice proper on the other. The rooms are very comfy and the staff are helpful and polite.Despite its central location it is not too noisy and the decor is old Italian with real charm. The prices are good for Venice and we will certainly stay there again. Lift access so good for disabled but a few steps to get down to the main entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible and charming”
Reviews.Author: boxbabe1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice 2 extra nights after our cruise, this hotel was very accessible from the port and right at the begining of the Grand Canal. Our room overlooked the Grand canal and had a little balcony (just to stand on) and you were able to watch all the going on outside. Being from America, we are used to having the bathrooms in our room, ours (Private just for my family) was right outside the room, which did take some getting used to. We found the courtyard in the back very relaxing. Restarants are within walking distance. Instead of a Gondola the front desk arranged for a Private Water Taxi, which was amazing, we saw the whole canal, Cemetary Island, Murano, and back canals which you would never see in the time and money allotted for a Gondola. The only problem we had, and its of no fault of the hotel, is someone walked off with my daughters (Not so cheap) sunglasses which her Dad just bought for her the day before. Over all would stay again, but I don't ever expect to get back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE= DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR TIME”
Reviews.Author: vgmaine
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! do not stay here or anywher else in Venice. People are rude and do not care to help. Worse experience in Europe ever!!!! The hotel was okay but the staff were not helpful or friendly. The bathroom shower did not work. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!! RUDE!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Maintenance woes”
Reviews.Author: Kahala4
Reviews.Content: We needed a room to accomodate four so we were put in their newer building which is the equivalent of a block away from the main building. We didn't realize this and would have preferred to know before committing. Additionally, the room was a handicap room and we didn't know. The shower had no curtain, as it was just one big open space, and the toilet had the commode on top that raised it so high our fee didn't reach the floor. Again, we would have liked to have known this beforehand. The biggest issue was that the air conditioning was broken. The room was so hot none of us slept and they had no fans for us to use. They fixed it the next day, but it barely cooled the room. The hotel did have parking which was a plus. The continental breakfast had a bit more than most in Italy, but the service was slow and we had to wait often for them to refill things. The hotel was clean and we did like the location. The vaporettos were right there. The hotel is in Plaza Roma so it takes about 15 minutes to get to Rialto and then another 20 minutes to get to St. Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the movies”
Reviews.Author: ChapelHill10
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was superb. Booking on line was easy and the hotel arranged to have a driver waiting to pick us up from the airport, which was fantastic too, as we arrived late and there were many people waiting in the first come first serve line. The hotel itself is located in a great spot, near the main bus and water taxi stations so getting around was easy. Our room was spotless and big. Loved the ten foot ceilings and chandelier in the room. Our view opened onto the main canal and a foot bridge and was postcard pretty. The bathroom was quite large and again, very clean. The staff were very helpful and the main rooms on the main floor (lobby, sitting room, dining room, bar) were very nicely appointed and again, served by very friendly staff. Would strongly recommend this hotel to either families or couples. (The elevator was tiny, but this seems normal anywhere in Europe where boutique hotels are concerned). Last comment - the bed was superb. Firm and comfortable - provided a great night's sleep. All in all great views, great location, super clean and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “We were Americans in Exile”
Reviews.Author: MSSarah2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel might be nice if you actually get to stay there. We were "Americans in Exile". They had us in a different building down the canal from our hotel. The room and bath were large with absolutely no charm to it - in a sketchy location. We did not feel safe. Everyone we met staying there were Americans. Hmmmm..... We were on the first floor, but one family we met who were on an upper floor had to haul their luggage down the stairs as they were told not to use the elevator. We had to walk back to the real hotel for breakfast, etc... Safe in room did not work, musty smell. The desk manager who checked us in was rude; internet only available in lobby of real hotel sometimes; no internet where we were.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: tylerWales
Reviews.Content: while driving through europe we stayed at this hotel. the location was excellent and it had whats rare in venice "parking". we had a room in the annex part of the hotel and the room was great and the bathroom was huge and in lovely condition. i would recommend this hotel to anyone.great price too.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: lorel
Reviews.Content: My parent and I had booked the Hotel Santa Chiara for one night at the start and end of our cruise. It was in a perfect location for us with our luggage and for my parents who didn't want to have to walk very far. We were handy to Piazzale Roma and could catch a taxi to the Cruise terminal, as well as a taxi to the airport. We only experienced a very courteous and helpful service from the all staff. We were offered the free taxi to Murano and we were assisted with booking of tickets to an Opera. The first night we stayed in the new building where we found our room to be very spacious and modern with everything in working order. The fact that the hotel is near the COOP grocery store is a plus as we could purchase some supplies. The second night we returned after our cruise and we had a room on the second floor of the older building. We had a view of the Grand Canal and we liked the quirky but traditional decor of the room. The breakfast was very good and sitting at the front of the dining room near the window gave us a most pleasant view while we enjoyed a leisurely breakfast. Thanks to all the staff for making our stay very pleasant. We will definitely recommend it to others and be sure to book again when we return. Mille Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zebra740
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite overlooking the glass bridge. I had read the reviews and heard that the old building was more charming, so requested a room there. Yes it was funky, with uneven flooring, a tiny, phone booth shower, not much counter space. But the charm of the building made up for it. The staff was charming, the breakfast good, and the location was unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Full marks for location - but that's it.”
Reviews.Author: akbardxb
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is great - very convenient to walk from the railway station and the main parking area; but that is about it. The rooms are small, the bathrooms are smaller and the worst are the shower areas. Once you get in, you can't turn or move around even to apply soap !! The drapes and the carpets in the rooms are rather old and give a damp feel to it. Lousy would be an understatement to describe the breakfast. The two young guys at the reception were very jovial and friendly but the old chap was rather grumpy and rude.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations in every way!”
Reviews.Author: GGLynch
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in Venice---fabulous view, right next to a vaparetto stop but far enough away from the overwhelming crowds that seem to be everywhere else. The staff was very helpful with our every request from restaurant recommendations to loaning us an umbrella to arranging a wonderful free water taxi ride to Murano. The breakfast buffet was very good with a lot of options. The rooms were very spacious and kept clean. The only downside was that the elevator broke a few times and we had to climb the stairs to our room--not a problem for my daughter but was for me since I was recovering from a knee injury. Beds were a bit hard as they are everywhere in Italy but the decor was charming (probably more for a feminine taste but very nice).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Voland718
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May, 2011. This hotel has pros and cons, so it's difficult to give it a single grade. Pros: Stayed in the attic room, so view was excellent and room was pretty large by European standards. Great location for access to train station and any other transport. Trip to historic center via vaporetto is great, this is the first stop, so easier to grab a seat and enjoy the views. Trip to the center takes about 20-30 minutes. Close to an excellent COOP supermarket. Staff is very corteous and helpful. Cons: While one of the cheaper hotels, still attic room is pretty expensive at 300+ euros per night. Hotel does not stock mosquite repellent and we couldn't find any eletric ones at COOP, so 2 nights out of 3 were restless, as we were battling local giant mosquitoes that got in the room from the terrace. Coming back from historic center via vaporetto can be a real hassle during peak hours. This is the last stop and can take over 1 hour in a VERY crowded water bus - real uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Affordable Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: travelbugqueen
Reviews.Content: Santa Chiara was recommended by a friend and we found it to be the perfect place to stay. It is so very easily accessible to the bus and train station without having to use a vaporette. Our room was elegantly decorated and we had a most beautiful balcony that overlooked the Grand Canal. In addition, the breakfast was great and served in a gorgeous dining area within the hotel. The hotel staff were most accommodating as well. Another important factor is cost. We were pleasantly surprised at the affordable cost with such nice amenities. We will definitely stay there again. We have stayed in Venice for the past 4 years and this is by far our favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is one of the worst I have used”
Reviews.Author: traveller1064365
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for 4 nights. We were given a tiny room with a very small bathroom, supposedly superior and overlooking the canal. The two windows were small and one was permanently shuttered. The state of the decor was dreadful and the handiwork was that of a very inexperienced "do it yourselfer." Every door, including the wardrobe had to be slammed shut. The waste bins were not emptied daily. The shower head was half blocked allowing only a dribble. The freestanding aircon unit was quite inadequate and agreed as such by the staff. The breakfast buffet was nearly always depleted as so little was put out. Replenishing was always a time consuming business. Likewise the coffee service was extremely slow and clearly the young lad involved was not up to the work. On our last morning the buffet had ants crawling over it. It is obvious that there is no appointed housekeeper who makes regular checks to ensure that the facilities are up to scratch To cap it all, having paid a charge of 245 Euros/night I was then charged an extra sum of 80 Euros for car parking. On leaving I noticed that there was an award notice at the reception desk showing that Trip Adviser had given 4 stars. I used this service to find the hotel and will look very carefully in future. During my tour of North Italy I stayed at magnificent hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ClareColwynBay
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel to everyone. We arrived from our cruise ship at 9.30am and were met with helpfulness and courtesy. Our room was not available which we fully expected but our luggage was stored and there are plenty of comfy chairs inside or a small sitting area outside if you don't want to go exploring -which we did. Our room was on the side -overlooking a small canal and the park. During the day the canal is quite busy but after everyone has gone home it is very quiet . Room and bathroom very clean. Breakfast was excellent with lots of choice. Hotel is right by the bus station, vaporetto stops and the Constitution Bridge . Will definitely come back

Reviews.Title: “if you are driving don't go past this hotl”
Reviews.Author: dororuss
Reviews.Content: we booked late got the best room overlooking the Grand Canal and had 1 wonderful day and night in this very clean and comfortable hotel if I drive back to Venice this is the hotel to stay

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access, No Luggage Hassle, Some Noise”
Reviews.Author: LUV_Hawaii2
Reviews.Content: We chose this Hotel because you can drive there in a car. There is no need to haul your luggage in a boat or hire an expensive Water Taxi. Most Hotels in Venice require a lot of effort to get your luggage to the Hotel. There is some noise outside the Hotel from buses, cars, and the boat dock. However, it quieted down at night so we could sleep. The inside of the Hotel is great. The rooms have adequate space and good furnishings. The Staff is very helpful and the Breakfast is abundant with lots of good choices.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest”
Reviews.Author: mioule06
Reviews.Content: Hotel conveniently located at the entrance of Venice, close to the train and bus station. But this has the drawback that it is not possible to have a quiet room there, since on two sides there are canals with a lot of boat traffic (some of them make even the windows vibrate!) and on the other side the bus station. I did not appreciate that the reservation desk confirmed that I would be able to get a quiet room when it was not possible.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: SSS100
Reviews.Content: The hotel was next to the coach and train station, therefore access to the airport and cruise terminal was very easy. The walk from the hotel to St Marks Square was very pleasant and would have taken approximately 20 mins, had we not stopped to admire the wonderful scenery and window shop in the many shops that lined the route. We stayed in the nearby hotel annexe in a large room that was nicely furnished. We enjoyed a peaceful night - although the annexe was just off the Grand Canal, it was tucked away down a quite alley. The reception staff spoke English and were very helpful. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyW
Reviews.Content: Great hotel ...very clean. Staff is fabulous. I was traveling solo on this trip and felt very safe. I stayed in room #304 which has a lovely view of the canal. The garden is charming and is a nice spot to sit and read or have a glass of wine. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is also in a great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basically a good hotel - but spoiled by lack of air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: Joemalvik
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its excellent location, right next to the bus station and one of the main water bus stops, and only a 5 minute walk from the train station. It is right on the canal, in a pleasant area. The hotel reception is clean and welcoming, and the rooms comfortable, especially for a 3* hotel. The style and decor are not up-to-date, and some might find that a problem. But I felt that it made me feel that I was for sure in an old Italian city, and that is much better than anonymous modernity. Breakfast was not wonderful, but perfectly adequate - and included in the price. The price was high by Italian standards - but reasonable compared to many other hotels of a similar standard that I looked up. If, like me, you need to combine a bit of business with pleasure and need to use internet for more than just a quick check of emails - look elsewhere. A wireless internet service was available which , they told me, covered only the reception area. But even there the signal quality and bandwidth was hopelessly inadequate, with download times so slow that many web operations I wanted to do, and sites I wanted to look up, simply did not work. And as I seemed to be the only person in the reception area, and as I tried on multiple occasions, I don't think a high load from multiple users was the explanation. I could accept all this for a free internet service - but they had the cheek to charge 5 euros. All of the staff were polite, and some were genuinely helpful. But some seemed bored by "standard" questions and gave short but useless answers. For instance to the question "Where can I find a cash dispensing machine?" one guy told me "Go out of the hotel and turn left - or turn right. There are machines all over the city." Sorry: but that does not help much. Later in the day I asked someone else who actually wanted me to find the machine and told me: "Go out of the hotel and turn right. Then take the first on the right and follow the road alongside the canal. The machine is on your right". So: some of the staff need to learn to answer questions such that guests can really understand the information - rather than just giving a short reply to make them go away. One major thing spoiled the hotel for me: they refused to turn on the air conditioning. When shown to my room I noticed it was not on and asked why. I was first told that it was because it was undergoing maintenance. I thought to myself: THAT is the kind of thing you do in the winter. So the story then got changed to the truth: we don't think it is hot enough in May to need it. Sorry: but I think this is something I think the guests should decide, not the management. However, they assured me that it would cool down at night. But it did not. It got very warm in the room as the day wore on, even though I left the window open. So when I wanted to sleep it was essential to keep the window open. That brought the temperature to 25 degrees which I think many people find too hot. It would have been unbearably warm with the window closed. The trouble is that an open window lets in not just cool air but also lots of noise from the boats on the river (until very late) *AND* the mosquitos. I had an uncomfortable sleep, and received multiple bites from which I am still itching many days afterwards. On the second night I specifically asked at reception that the air conditioning be turned on, at night at least. The friendly man there said he would pass my request on to management. But nothing was done. I think it is a shame that an otherwise OK hotel spoils things by thinking it knows better than guests about how warm is too warm, and saving a bit of cash by not providing a facility that is in advertised as being provided.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, Wonderful View”
Reviews.Author: Leu1963
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the St. Lucia train station. One can check in, drop off bags in room and start exploring. We chose a room with a view; it was worth it. Waking up and going to bed with the view of the Grand Canal was an additional touch to the whole Venice experience. Complimentary breakfast every morning made for a good start.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Small Hotel in busy Location”
Reviews.Author: Aramcon
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and enjoyed the Hotel and the location. Be aware it is not an out of the way quiet location...it is right on busy part of the grand canal and next to bus dropoffs and the train station. Great for us as we came by train and just had to take our luggage across the street. You will need to buy day passes to boat taxis to get to various sites. Also great location if you come by car as parking is very close. Overall a high quality three star hotel that is very reasonably prices (more so during the week).

Reviews.Title: “more than just a great location”
Reviews.Author: freebird_9
Reviews.Content: A good clean and friendly hotel. We had a room overlooking the grand canal which was brilliant - there was always something of interest to watch.

Reviews.Title: “superb location, the rooms with views are wonderful, the staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: joekr
Reviews.Content: Before booking, some of the reviews on these pages gave me pause, but this hotel had also been recommended by a friend and so we booked, having to reserve two different rooms because our firsr choice (attic room) was booked for some of our four day stay. Everything about the place was really fine. from an excellent breakfast to helpful staff, particularly with the change of rooms. Leaving, we received marvelous help getting to the train on the vaporetto, avoiding the chore of dragging our luggage over the new bridge over the Grand Canal. We had arrived by rental car, and this is one of the few hotels where this is not only possible, but quite simple.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Angels67
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, very near from Piazalle Roma amb rooms are good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Venice; rooms are OK”
Reviews.Author: mikekSingapore
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at the Santa Chiara but have learned to set lower expectations for Venice Hotels (rooms are smaller, transportation troublesome, can be noisy). Few headlines for people traveling with families: * We originally booked quad room. We found the room unacceptable as our 10 and 11 year old daughters are tall and we would have been falling over each other. Need to book two rooms for a family. We negotiated an extra charge of 30 Euro per night. * Rooms in the main building have charm; however, we stayed at their second property (about 100 meters away) and the rooms were much larger. However, little charm and bit out-of-date. * Ask for room not facing the bus lot -- it can be noisy. * Location is GREAT. You can take a 3 Euro bus to the Venice bus station. The hotel is 50m away. We didn't originally know location and spent 100 Euros on a boat. We took the bus back to the airport! You'll see many people lugging their suitcases up and down Venice bridges -- not necessary at the Santa Chiara. * Staff was excellent on suggesting activities, restaurants, places to see. * They charge for internet access. I find this frustrating (they are not the only hotel). We kindly asked to get access; they offered 2 hours free (2 hours total time, didn't have to be continuous) which met our needs. Thanks to the staff for the free offer. Overall Venice was our least favorite city during our European tour. We found it over touristy, expensive and sub-standard rooms. The people were kind. We just much prefer Tuscany or Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good services”
Reviews.Author: Nadine_G_N
Reviews.Content: Good location, good staff, good breakfast and very good coffee at breakfast, beautiful old building

Reviews.Title: “A little gem ....”
Reviews.Author: Totoro_Dec
Reviews.Content: we arrived from Rome and were greeted with smiles when we walked into the little hotel. altho check in was later, we had arrived around 10.30am ... but on checking, the manager on duty found the room was available, so we went in early. Which was wonderful as we were able to dump our stuff, and start exploring Venice. we were also super pleased that there was CNN & BBC on TV! Yes! ... i felt lost without my news channels whilst in Rome. The next morning, breakfast was delightful, we thought we would have to go out and search for food; but the manager said - nope, go have breakfast. it was a simple but very good spread. Before we left that morning, i asked for extra pillows; and that nite, it was there .... the rooms were also well cleaned ... What i will really remember about this little hotel are the smiles and warm service we got from the manager and the staff at this little gem of a hotel. For sure, we will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: meripie
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, gorgeous rooms, friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for late arrival /early departures, families and handicapped”
Reviews.Author: daeiclark
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Chiara has an 'annex' called Residence Parisi which is where we stayed. It is a set of larger rooms (they were specifically designed for handicapped). The room had a massive bathroom, wider entrances and a generally more spacious quadruple room than many other hotels in this price bracket. Great for families staying in the one room. These rooms are in an 'annex' which is nearby (about a 1 min walk) on the Grand Canal and accessed through a quiet courtyard. Book in at the easy to find Hotel Chiara and bell boy takes luggage on a trolly. FABULOUS location on the Canal, right near the bus station,a water ferry stop and bridge across the canal. Supermarket in next building. Perfect for those coming in late or leaving early, as we did. We pitied those we saw lugging children and bags over bridges and down narrow lanes trying to figure out cryptic signs and directions to their hotel or apartments! The room had a comfy queen (or was it king?) bed and a fold out sofa bed - okay for kids but an adult could feel the support bars. The hotel Santa Chiara staff were professional, friendly and helpful, with great email communication throughout.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hub”
Reviews.Author: travelalot01273
Reviews.Content: stayed at the santa chiara for four nights at the end of december, couldn't have asked for more. lovely room, spotless, kept clean and tidy, staff very helpful and friendly, always got a cheery buon giorno in the morning. very good breakfast, plenty to set you up for your day exploring the narrow streets and canals of venice. perfectly located for trains and buses and of course water buses and taxies. overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Short, but sweet.”
Reviews.Author: Cimmaron
Reviews.Content: We arrived around midnight, but our room was ready. The hotel is conveniently located on the Piazzale Roma, perfect for a late night arrival since it is next to the main transportation hub of Venice, and also close to the train station. The room was comfortable and quiet. Breakfast the next morning was good, and the checkout was late enough for us to take a stroll around some of Venice before we caught our cruise. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: murphy963
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed for a week at this nice and convenient hotel. Hotel location is excellent since one can get easy access to transport (both by land and water). The staff are very friendly and effecient. Hope by the time we visait again they will have the digital terrestial tv system working.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and best for you pay”
Reviews.Author: zgulbahar
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for 3 nights. This was maybe the only hotel in Venice island that you may go directly to the hotel's garage by car, which is very important if you have children and more baggages than a small family. It's also along the grand canal, besides a vapouretto stop, so you may directly dive into Venice's secret. Our room was big enough, comfortable (except some bus stop noise from Piazza Roma) and had a good scene. Reception personnel, breakfast , service and cleanliness was more over the avarage. Thanks to the personnel for all of these.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stefrank
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel but we didn't realize the bus station was literally right behind the hotel. Great customer service, great location, great everything else. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, but needs work”
Reviews.Author: jdonn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a mixed bag. On the positive side, the convenient location, wonderful views, helpful staff, fine breakfast buffet. The negative: Although this hotel was at one time an elegant, beautifully furnished lodging, it has seen better days. Our room was so dimly lit, we actually used a flashlight to get around. Cigarette holes in the bedspread & less than acceptable cleaning in the tiny bathroom. If the hotel would invest in some light bulbs & more conscientious cleaning staff, it would be really terrific

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hcook12
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location, right in front of the bus station and across the canal from the train station which made it perfect for us since we arrived by air and left by train. It's also the perfect spot to start and end your tour of the Grand Canal.The room was beautiful, overlooking the canal, and it was very clean and well maintained. We had a full bathroom and nice sized shower in the room and the bed was very comfortable. This was definitely one of the larger rooms that we stayed in on our 10 day 4 city tour of Spain and Italy. The hotel staff were incredibly friendly and helpful (especially the night staff who helped us with the computer when we had trouble navigating a slightly different keyboard). The breakfast buffet was delicious and plentiful. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Marian93
Reviews.Content: The location is very close to the train which makes it convenient. Everything was clean, top notch breakfast, friendly staff. What more can I say? My daughter and I had a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views! Small room...with phonebooth size shower.”
Reviews.Author: Golfergirl63
Reviews.Content: The location was very good - one waterbus stop from the train station. Right on the water with beautiful views. I went with my husband and 20 year old daughter. We rented a triple - which was a double bed and twin bed in very small room! But it's manageable for 1 or 2 nights and the beds were comfortable. The room was nice and quiet despite the location near the waterbus stop. The breakfast was average - but okay. The shower was the size of a phonebooth - so difficult for anything other than very quick shower - but my husband is over 6 feet and 230 lbs and he managed. Overall very typical European hotel (smaller than we Americans are used to) - but a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: lfeltus
Reviews.Content: I spent hours on the internet reading reviews and getting information before selecting the Santa Chiara Hotel. Some of the older reviews for this hotel were not very good but we are experienced travelers and recognize that some people have unreal expectations. We loved Venice and we loved this hotel. A perfect location. We drove from Rome and were able to drive right into the hotel parking area and forget about the car until it was time to leave Venice. It is situated on the Grand Canal across from the train station. We were in a double superior room with a canal view. We loved watching pedestrians crossing the bridge going to and from the train station and the colorful boats cruising the canal. I was initially concerned that it would be noisy at night, but was pleasantly surprised that simply closing the windows provided quiet nights of sleep. We did not need the air conditioner, but it was available for summer travelers. The room was very clean, spacious and beautifully decorated. The staff were very pleasant and the breakfast was more than adequate. The ambience of this hotel contributed to our enjoyment of the total Venice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: n00dle22
Reviews.Content: Our room on the third floor was large and the bathroom was newly remodeled with the shower area a little on the small side. We had a great stay with the front desk very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was good and comparable to most hotel offerings. Saw the negative reviews on TA but decided to try it for ourselves and we are satisfied with our stay. The rooms need updating but taking the whole experience in itself, it is a great place. It is all relative to our degree of expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and falling apart, with snobby service”
Reviews.Author: Jpkneifl
Reviews.Content: I had the displeasure of staying at the Santa Chiara hotel for 2 days while my family and I were visiting Venice recently. We loved Venice, but not necessarily this hotel. First of all, it's falling apart badly. Both of the hotel's concierges were snobby and rude. There was a bell man there that was extremely nice and a very hard worker. They have hidden charges for everything - parking, internet, etc. The walls and ceilings are in need of major repair. Not worth the money I paid - at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...didn't have to walk through crowded alleys with luggage to find hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GayleG_10
Reviews.Content: From the outside, the hotel is beautiful. It's convieniently located to buses, boats, and bridges. All within short walking distance. There's a nice water fountain at the lobby entrance. Breakfast buffet was decent - no omlets in Italy just continental fare. The 4th floor room was clean but dimly lit the dingy antique floral wall covering which even covered the doors. The air conditioner wasn't working. It blew out warm air and although we requested someone to try to fix it, it was never fixed. So it was rather uncomfortable sleeping. And if we opened the 2 windows for air, all the bugs flew in! The big plus is that we didn't have to walk through the crowded streets with our luggage to find a hotel deeper into the city. We saw many people doing this and glad it wasn't us.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: acanoles
Reviews.Content: I have read so many negative reviews about thishotel and I don't understand. I think it might be the spoiled American syndrome - we are used to things being large, being new, comfortable and convenient. I think people forget they are travelling to an ancient city where culture and pracicality dictate things like less space (smaller rooms). After having spent most of my trip in a rented apartment and seeing what other Venice hotels were like as well as the prices, this place was perfect. I had a tiny room, which I expected. Don't think many spaces or rooms in Venice are large. I had a tiny but very clean and efficient private bathroom which worked well. Can't say I saw many places having tubs there. Perhaps the $500 per night fancy hotels. The details and furnishings were tasteful and pleasant, adding a nice touch. My room contained a mini-bar, beautiful furnishings, tv and was air conditioned. The a/c alone was worth the price, which to me was a bargain considering its location especially after having priced other hotels there. I was extremely pleased with the cost considering what I pay for hotels domestically in the US, what I had looked at and also stayed at prior to this in Venice and using these as comparisons. I was very pleased with the breakfast. I have yet to stay at am American hotel that offers anything so nice with such a variety. The service was great too. My bed wasn't the most comfortable but I have a hard time sleeping when I travel anyway but truth be told I slept just fine there. I enjoyed my stay and think fondly of this hotel. I would stay there again and recommend it. My only question is in hindsight thinking they may have provided airport transportation and not having asked about that when I checked in. I found the staff friendly, patient with my inability to speak Italian, helpful and true to everything they told me. I even received a great restaurant recommendation from them that I was actually quite pleased with.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with stunning views, but check the bathroom is in the room!!”
Reviews.Author: Maz216
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 1 night before going a cruise. The Hotel was very easy to get to even later in the evening. We got a bus from right outside Marco Polo Airport and this took us to the Venice Bus Terminal - you can see the Hotel from the bus terminal and it was an easy transfer even with 2 young children and 4 suitcases! The first impression of the hotel is very favourable - very clean and well looked after. We checked in and at this point we were told that we were in Room 102. Room 102 was lovely - marble floor with a few rugs, blue silk wallpaper, shuttered windows that could be opened to give an amazing view of the Grand Canal and 3 beds (a kingsize bed, a lovely dark wood sleigh bed and a forth perfectly adequetate camp style bed). However we were told that the bathroom for Room 102 was not in the room! We were then given the key to Room 102 and were told our bags would follow us up. It was on the first floor and had a large central landing which had the doors to all the other rooms on that level along with the bathroom for our room. While we were assured that the bathroom was for only our room, to get to it you had to go out onto the public landing and then stand there (in your jammies if you dared) and unlock the door to the bathroom and then remember to stand out in the hall again to lock it before returning to Room 102. This really is not ideal at the best of times, however our youngest was unwell after a long day travelling and began being sick shortly after 9pm; with no en-suite bathroom we had to grab the bin from the bathroon and 'make-do' until she stopped being sick at around 3am! These days you expect an en-suite in your room as standard and considering the price we paid to stay here (it was not cheap) - we were disappointed to be let down by this - I expected an 'in room' bathroom. I would stay in this hotel again, (although not in Room 102, even if it was the only room available), provided that the bathroom was part of the room! (I know I am really going on about this but it was a big disappointment and a huge inconvenience). The staff were pleasant and called a taxi for us in the morning to take us to the Cruise Terminal after we had a walk around the area - Venice was truely amazing. I have thought really hard about the ratings and if the other rooms are true 'en-suite' and are decorated and kept like Room 102, then I would have rated the Hotel, Rooms and Value score as 'Excellent'. I have rated the Sleep Quality highly as despite the fact that we didn't get much sleep, had the circumstances been different the room would have afforded a comfortable night. I would recommend this hotel, as long as they asked not to stay in the dreaded (no matter how good the view) Room 102!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for cruise”
Reviews.Author: Bud-n-Lin
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfect location for cruise. View out of our room was gorgeous of the canal and new footbridge. Room was musty, decor old, and overall room was showing its age. Air conditioning was blowing warm air. Cooler to have windows open. If not cruising, I would pick a hotel more central to St. Mark's (San Marco area or Rialto Bridge area). Staff was friendly and helpful. Btw key is attached to a large wooden key chain, making it a must to leave it before going out

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! great location!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle_Nunez
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. All was ok but it can be better. The best of it was the location and the parking, since we drove from Switzerland and needed a place for our car. Room was ok, 1 queen bed, 2 twin beds and a really big bathroom. It was clean and just what we wanted.
