Breakfast was also good but we think the hotel needs more help during this time, it was not enough having only 2 waiters helping and replacing what was out of stock. Also, we did not know that the room had a minibar, we noticed when leaving. We had a great stay, loved to be in front of the grand cana, the vaporetto terminals, lots of restaurants and having a Coop supermarket next door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accessible hotel”
Reviews.Author: hel-40
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed for 5 nights in the residenza parisi annexe. I was concerned as being in a wheelchair can present problems but from the minute we arrived in pizalle roma our concerns started to vanish. We had arrived in a fully accessible public bus from Marco Polo airport ( easier by far than any english bus) I had booked the hotel by internet and was concerned but the welcome was easy and very friendly. We were whisked to our hotel room with help with our luggage and on arrival in our room I was so pleased to see the description of the wheelchair accessible hotel room was accurate. It was large and spacious allowing me freedom of movement and access into an excellent level access bathroom. The air conditioning was brilliant and the room quiet and peaceful.The breakfast room (when we woke up in time) was easy for me and so was the bar, full marks for being accessible. Thank you sooooooooo much for enabling me to have the holiday in venice I thought I could only dream about. We were able to use the vaporrettos and access a good part of the city and everyone was so helpful. I was able to live my dream thanks to the Santa Chiara hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: JulGer80
Reviews.Content: We were going to cruise so opted to Santa Chiara because of its nice location. We would defenitely recommend the hotel to anybody who is going to cruise! You can simply take public transport in Marco Polo airport to get to the hotel. Our room on the 1st floor of annex was always clean. But we were a bit surprised to discover that there was just a roll-away bed for the third person in a Triple room:-( Breakfast was really good (btw a breakfast room with a view of the Grand Canal was very cosy).There were not any mosquitos at all during 2 nights! There is a grocery store close to the hotel where you can buy cheap water. The staff were really very helpful and I guess we will stay here in case of possible visits to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel which truly exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerManchesterUK
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Venice for the first time celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary and I was a little nervous about the transfers to/from the Airport. My fears were unfounded however with the Santa Chiara being ideally placed as the Airport bus drops you off virtually at the rear of the hotel and just a 2 minute walk to reception. The front of the Hotel has a lovely view overlooking the Grand Canal being in an ideal position to catch the Vaporetta. Our room on the second floor was spacious, very clean and with window shutters closed at night we had a noiseless sleep. Both the Air conditioning and room safe were free of charge. The breakfast room looks out over the canal and the food selection was excellent. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. It is a great location to explore the delights of Venice and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel right by the main transportation area...walk right to the hotel from the bus/taxi/car lot”
Reviews.Author: skygoddess333
Reviews.Content: nice clean room with a great view of the canal. The lobby bar is nice, breakfast is included, it was good. The staff was formal, but friendly. Mostly it is a great location if you are only staying one day, say for a cruise, take the bus from the airport & walk across the parking lot to your room.. it beats the stress of hauling lyggage onto a boat & then across bridges & bad sidewalks!

Reviews.Title: “It was what we expected except for the Vaporetto rumbling noises”
Reviews.Author: Kiyokiko
Reviews.Content: I chose Santa Chiara because of its location (we were going on a cruise) and we were not disappointed. The hotel is quite nice by European standards; the room was adequate and clean. In other cities it may only be a 3-star, but this is Venice, where almost everything is old and run down. The reception was very nice, helpful and accommodating. The porter was nice and polite as well. Our room had a view of the Grand Canal, which was good, but posed a problem later that night. The Vaporettos and water taxis run through the night (I thought) and there was a stop right outside our window. The noises , for me were quite bothersome as I am a light sleeper. Note to self: Next time ask for a room away from the water. The breakfast was more than adequate. We were allowed to leave our luggages after we checked out, which allowed us to have an enjoyable walk to St. Mark's square. It was a good walk; we took the vaporetto back to the hotel. I recommend this hotel for its convenience and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious clean room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: paulyMaine
Reviews.Content: We found our room to be spacious by European standards.A birds eye view of a canal adjoinuing the Grand Canal made you feel a part of Venice. The Roma vaperetto stop is just out the door making the whole city accessable AND being near the bus terminis made getting to and from the airport a cinch for only 5 euros -faster,more comfortable and more convenient than the water taxis and vaps.Vincent,at the desk, was most helpful and pleasant to deal with. We willl go back for our fourth trip to Venice and will probable stay at Santa Chiara for the spacious rooms, and location so close to the transportation systems.

Reviews.Title: “Attic room best room in ALL of Venice”
Reviews.Author: pumpcaptain
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the attic room is the best hotel room available in all of Venice. I searched for several months to find a room like this. I can't speak for any of the other rooms though. The attic room is very plush on a floor all by itself with a huge private terrace overlooking the Grand Canal, the Garden Park, and a side canal. Because you're on the top floor by yourself it is very private; no neighbors. The room is pricey but worth it. The best thing is you can walk from the train station across the new bridge and you're there, or from the airport just take the bus to the main station and you're right there. No taxis or shuttles needed. The staff was very nice to us, and the breakfast was very diverse. The coffee was excellent. It ashame that not everyone who stayed at this hotel didn't have the same experience as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location,---- but it's not enough”
Reviews.Author: gottogonow
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the cruise terminal and the public transportation. It could not have been a better location for that. Service was generally good, Vincento was a sweet heart and the young men that served our continental breakfast and moved our ample luggage (traveling with friends) were super. The room we had was very dark (mentioned in earlier reviews) and we paid 40 Euros extra per night for a canal view. Our window was level with the new walking bridge and just a few yards away, we were almost head to head with the pedestrians. We left the window cracked for a few hours while we were sightseeing and when we came back to the hotel the window was closed and shuttered. The a/c was on max but it was still warm in the room. The mosquitos had a smorgasbord. We are covered with bites. My husband killed one but sleeping under the covers was out of the question and the flowered wallpaper made it impossible to get the others. When I mentioned to Alexandro at the desk that I wasn't happy with the 80 euros that I was paying for sleeping with no light or fresh air he told me that I could have opened the shutters. He was very professional but not very helpful on this point. Live and learn. Do not pay for an "upgraded" canal room. We were in 30l. It ended up being substantially smaller than our friend's room, 307 and not nearly as nice. All for 80 Euros more. I just think that the clerk should have leveled with me about the window situation. I feel a little taken. We have traveled extensively through Europe over the years and this was my worst experience with a room and this was by no means a "budget hotel".

Reviews.Title: “A good location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: goodtimesArizona
Reviews.Content: During our two week stay in Italy, this was a great way to end our stay. We began in Rome and enjoyed the stay but it was very busy and congested. In Florence we experienced the worst attitudes and service we have ever seen ( my wife is a former Four Seasons Maui employee and the Malaspina hotel Florence, staff wouldn't even last through the first day of training) but it was refreshing to end our trip with a nice cozy, conveniently located hotel with a helpful staff. They made their best attempt to help us with any requests or information. The front desk manager directed us to the outdoor fish and produce market which was amazing and we would not have found without his tip. The breakfast was adequate and saved us a quite a bit of money on meals. I can't speak for the other travelers that left bad reviews, but I have nothing bad to say about the Santa Chiara Hotel. They brought a perfect end to our trip and helped to offset the bad service we experienced in Florence.

Reviews.Title: “Don't accept room on 4th floor, smells bad, poor service”
Reviews.Author: steviez
Reviews.Content: Donâ€™t accept a room on the 4th floor. The hotel itself if lovely. The lobby and dinning areas are nice. Itâ€™s a good location near the train station and maybe a little too close to the bus station. The 4th floor is the attic of the building. Imagine sleeping in your attic in the summertime. As big and cute as our room was with itâ€™s view of the bus station parking lot ( and all the late night noise that goes with that) it was very hot. I asked twice at the desk about having the AC checked or getting a different room. The first employee said heâ€™d check into it. The second said the AC worked just fine. Both employees seemed indifferent and bothered by the request, especially the second man. The temperature in the lobby and up to the 3rd floor ( where the elevator stops) was fine. As we walked up the very narrow staircase to the 4th floor hallway, the temp went up 10 degrees. Our room was another 5-7 degrees warmer than the 4th floor hallway. Luckily we were only there for 2 nights. The second night we had a wonderful rainstorm the dropped the temp considerably in about Â½ hr, so that night wasnâ€™t too bad. Perhaps it was because we were on the top floor, but it seemed as if the entire hotel septic system was venting out our shower drain. Our room had that chemical smell of a port-a-potty. Since it was cooler outside than in our room, we slept with the windows wide open both nights. The mosquitoes were less of a problem then the heat and smell. They do charge for internet, which some other hotels did as well, but it was as slow as dial up and I was kicked off the system 3 times in 30 min. Compared to the other 3 hotels we stayed June 2009, the Santa Chiara was the worst for service. Paris (all Seasons Voltaire Republique) is an easy 10 rating, Florence (the Balestri) an 8, Rome (the Oxford) a 10 and the Santa Chiara a 4. The room was the biggest of our trip and had the best in room safe. All in all, if you stay on any other floor and donâ€™t need anything from the staff, it would be a great hotel. Now you can read the hotel managers response where he says some BS gibberish about being sorry for our problems.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, complacent staff, disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jasper17Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as due to circumstances we needed parking in Venice. From the word go, the staff were unhelpful, in particular the main reception clerk who was supercilious and condescending. At over 200 euros per night for a dismal double room this was over-charging at its best! When waiting for our friends, we tried to get a drink in the hotel bar at 1.45 in the afternoon and were told it was closed. could not recommend this place apart from the fact that it has parking - but be warned, they insist on keeping your keys so that they can move cars at will and stack them like sardines in the tiny carpark.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good rooms - even the "Residence Parisi"”
Reviews.Author: Tess01
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were more than satisfied with our stay here. The hotel staff were helpful and polite and spoke English very well. We stayed in the "Residence Parisi" which was actually quite nice, despite my misgivings after reading reviews on tripadvisor. The rooms and bathrooms are huge! Yes, they are a little bit dark and there is no view, but they are modern, very clean and quiet! They are about 200m from the hotel, which while not ideal for breakfast, is not really too much bother. The "residence" is also nearer to the Piazzale Roma vaporetto stop than the main hotel, but we could not hear any noise from it. As stated previously, this hotel is in a great location whether you arrive by train, car or bus. Arriving by train, turn right out of the station and walk over the newly constructed bridge. By car or bus, you need to walk down towards the grand canal and it is slighly to the right of the new bridge. It is literally just a couple of minutes walk! When leaving Venice by air, take the bus. It leaves from a stop just behind the hotel every 30 minutes and takes just 20 minutes. It cost only 3 euro! The hotel will direct you to the office where you can get the timetable and buy the tickets. For travel within Venice we bought the vaporetto tickets for 48 hours and with the large Piazzale Roma vaporetto station so close, nothing was too far away. The vaporetto's run all night. This stop is the other end of the grand canal from Piazza San Marco etc, but the number 1 goes right along the canal frequently. It does stop at every stop however! Piazzale Roma is also a good stop to catch the vaporetto to Murano - it only takes minutes as it does not go via the Grand Canal. The only negative would be perhaps the lack of view. In an ideal world I would have liked a room in the main hotel so I could have a view of the Grand Canal (though I would have sacrificied the quiet perhaps). Anyway, I did not ask the staff, and was quite satisfied with the room I was given. Good points - location, size and cleanliness of rooms, quiet Bad points - separate from main hotel, no view

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: dizzyblonde51
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel before embarking on a Transatlantic cruise to Rio. I choose the hotel as it was near the bus station and at the end of the Grand Canal so I would be able to see some of Venice in a short time. However my experience at the hotel was so horrible I feel compelled to warn other travellers so that they can avoid staying there. I arrived at the hotel at 3.00pm only to be told that my room was not ready and to have a coffee in the hotel bar while it was being finished (the coffee was very pricey!). After 30 minutes I told reception that I wanted to go sightseeing before it got dark and was told that the room was now ready for me. On entering the room I was overpowered by the smell of smoke. It was obvious that the previous guest had chain-smoked in the room and as the room was tiny with only a small window blocked off by scaffolding the smell would not be easily dissipated and would linger for a long time. I immediately went to tell reception that as I am asthmatic I could not stay in this room and wanted to be moved into another one. The receptionist told me that he would sort the matter out and I went off to explore Venice for a couple of hours. On returning I was taken back to the same room which had now been copiously sprayed with some awful air purifier making the situation worse. On returning to reception I asked again for another room but was told that this was not possible even after I said I would be happy to pay for an upgrade to another room. As it was impossible to find another room in Venice so late on a Saturday evening I was forced to spend a very uncomfortable night in this hotel...an experience I would never want to repeat again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: CentralFLchick
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Santa Chiara in Venice. What a wonderful little hotel with an attentive, friendly, english-speaking staff in the best location ever! On the Grand Canal - but still accessible by car, the hotel is immediate to: the main bus station to catch a bus to/from the airport (which is the fastest way), great restaurants, the main stop for the vaparetto (the city's water busses), the free boat to the casino, shopping, the new bridge (that is not on any maps yet), a park with a playground, and the train station! The hotel has a darling little bar to have a drink and people-watch at the end of a long day and the best views, ever. Would definitely go back and stay here although the beds were a little hard.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location But Sure to Stay in the Main Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Atenant
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location in Venice if you're going to use the bus or taxi to connect to the cruise terminal or Marco Polo Airport and have more two or more pieces of luggage. You don't need to cross any bridges after getting off or going to the buses. There two sites to this hotel, the original Santa Chiara building and the Residence Parisi located about a 300 feet from the main building. The hotel lobby and breakfast room is located in the main building. I did not get a chance to see any of the rooms in the main building, which had good reviews from previous guests at the hotel. We were put up for the night in the Residence Parisi located in front of the Piazza Roma Vaporetti stop which is very convenient. The room was large, about 20 ft by15 ft., however the room was dark and sparsely furnished. There was only one wooden chair, a small table, two night stands and a bed. The bed had two double mattresses, and they both sagged toward the middle and should have been replaced long ago. Since we only spent one night in Venice and not much time in the room, it was quite acceptable but for $300 a night I was hoping for a little more ambiance. When you're in the room you don't feel like you're in Venice, it feels more like a Motel 6 in the US. If not for the location and our four pieces of luggage, I would have stayed at the Antiche Figure a short distance away with our cruise companions, but they only had two pieces of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TravelCouple11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 days, and it was very nice. It is walking distance from the train station. We had taken the train from Rome to Venice and we thought we would have to take a water bus and try to figure out where this hotel was, but as soon as we got into Venice, we were told by a nice helpful couple that this hotel was right over the big bridge. Our room was decent, with the basics - bed, tv, shower, toilet. It was not that big, but then again, nothing in Italy was (you should see the elevators, they are half the size of USA elevators). After reading the reviews on this site, we were ready to be taken to the Residinzia which is supposedly not at the santa chiara, but were surprised to find out our room was right in the hotel on the 3rd floor over looking the canal. Really nice view. Only complaint was that the noise from the water buses and boats is loud at night when you are trying to sleep, but it seemed to have quieted down after midnight. the staff was helpful and friendly, we asked for a street map and they gave one to us (usually costs 2-3 euros if you try to buy one outside). Breakfast was OK. There was plenty to choose from, but egg-wise, only hard boiled brown eggs (no scrambled or omelettes or anything). Overall we enjoyed our stay at Santa Chiara, and its location very close to the water bus station at Piazza Roma and train station and bus station just cannot be beat, and we felt very safe there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheRfamily
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all the staff Santa Chiara Hotel. My Husband and our two teenage daughters stayed at this hotel for two nights. We had a very lovely stay. Very clean, quiet, safe and very professional, and customer oriented staff. Our room was large, very clean, and Venice style. What a pleasure to feel real Venician Style, I could not imagine staying elsewhere. Large windows facing the beautiful canal, and air-conditioned. The Bedding was very comfortable and sufficient Toiletries provided. The shower water however leaked into the bathroom floor, so some of the extra towels provided were used to clean up the water on the floor. Just be careful not to slip. Shower space also a bit small, however we made due. The breakfast provided was delicious and served in a very upscale style. We used the internet a night. Perfect. We were travelling by car, so the parking lot which is right next to the hotel is perfect. My husband was pleasantly helped with all our luggage to our room on arrival and departure. We were very pleased with this service. We will recommend Santa Chiara Hotel to our family and friends, and we hope to visit again soon. Many Thanks, The R Family

Reviews.Title: “A Real Find”
Reviews.Author: mtek
Reviews.Content: I had been to Venice many times before and stayed in a variety of accommodation types. One of the things that always seemed to get bad reviews was a choice of hotel near either Piazzale Roma or Ferrovia - in general accommodation near either bus or rail station can be hit and miss. However the last time I was in Venice was in December 2007 and stayed in the Hotel Olimpia right beside Piazzale Roma. I had a great stay and the hotel was wonderful - I think I wrote a review. However at that time I noticed the Santa Chiara on my way back in the vaporetti each evening and thought it looked very promising. In February 2008 I booked a flight and the hotel (through the airline's booking system) and was all set for another 5 nights in Venice starting on 3rd September 2008. In the weeks before travelling I had read reviews of the hotel on this site and was not confident of a great time. Then disaster struck. I had a minor accident a week before travelling which resulted in a major sprain to my ankle and for 3 days I could not put weight on it. I considered cancelling but, needing the rest, decided to make the best of it. The ankle sprain made organisation for the trip very difficult. That was made worse by the weather forecast I had seen on one of the weather sites which had forecast rain for most of my stay. So on Wednesday 3rd September I arrived in Treviso Airport from Dublin at about 9.45am after a very early start. So now I was tired as well as having an injured ankle. During the drive on the ATVO bus into Venice I could see that it had rained and I had fewer concerns about my lack of summery and light clothing. Once the bus stopped in Piazzale Roma my ankle started to feel better but the humidity (combined with the 2.30am start) started to take its toll. I walked down the few steps to the entrance of the Santa Chiara (not the one on the Grand Canal) and there was a small terrace with a water feature (turned on later in the day), two tables and chairs. I went inside the hotel to ask if I could leave my case there until the official check in time of 2pm and the front of house Manager (not seeing me limp) immediately phoned the housekeeping staff to ascertain when my room would be ready. When I saw him do this I said that I was in no rush and would come back at 2pm but he insisted that the room would be ready soon and I should wait. I went outside for a cigarette (I know - filthy habit) and before I had finished he came out to tell me the room was ready. Inside a porter took my case and took me up in the lift to room 304 in the hotel itself - not the Paresi which (given what I had paid I expected to maybe be booked into). The porter showed me the safe, mini bar, air-con etc and did not hang around for a tip although I did catch him in time. The room was small but what single room in any hotel is not. It was so very very clean and kept that way throughout my five days stay. The furniture was fake antique but very much in the style of the age of the building. When I opened the shutters on the window I realised that I was looking out on the Grand Canal - the only single room in the hotel with this view. If people look at the hotel website where it appears that breakfast is set out on a terrace overlooking the canal - well my room was the room under this premier room and shared its views. Despite the throbbing ankle, the heat and the humidity I quickly unpacked and headed off. The front of house Manager was very concerned that I had a map etc - no attempt at any selling of excursions though they had plenty on offer including opera nights etc. I told him that I had been in Venice many times and he wished me a pleasant stay.. Returning to the room that evening the only problem of the stay. I put this in my comment form so it will come as no surprise to the Hotel Management. The room could do with better light for reading. Because I travel alone I usually get up early, go out for several hours, come back for shower and change, sit and read for an hour and then go for dinner and come back and read some more. In room 3004 there were two wall lights but on the opposite wall from the bed. There was a lamp on the bureau again opposite the bed and another on top of the mini bar cabinet. By moving the two lights on the bureau and the mini bar cabinet I could just about read in the evening. A reading lamp above the bed would have been much appreciated. The room had a very comfortable bed, mini bar, large wardrobe, safe and the bed linen was changed every day. The hotel does not have a restaurant but they can recommend places to eat - I never asked because I knew where I wanted to eat each day. Breakfast is served from 715 to 10.30 in a light and airy room looking out on the canal and the new bridge. Breakfast was fruits and cereals, yogurts, pastries, rolls, ham, cheese, eggs, tea, coffee, juices,water etc. The porter who took my case to the room on arrival was the one in charge of breakfast, making tea/coffee and replenishing supplies. He was very efficient and very friendly as all the staff were and their English was excellent. He and his colleagues also manned the small bar area opposite the breakfast room (also with a canal view). The entire hotel was air conditioned which was wonderful after the heat and humidity of the day. In fact some nights I woke up during the night and had to pull on a blanket the air con was working so efficiently. An added plus to the hotel is that the half way point of the Regatta Storica is must meters away along the Grand Canal and I could watch the parade and the races from my bedroom window. This morning my flight from Treviso was at 10.10 and the bus left Piazzale Roma at 7.30am. However I decided to get the 7.00 bus and went down to check out at 6.30am. Once again the staff were kind and concerned - wanting to know if I wanted breakfast before I left even though it was before the breakfast starting time. Yesterday - Sunday 7th September 2008 - I met an English couple who were well travelled and "very mature". They were staying in the Paresi and had not one bad word to say about it. Their views on the hotel, its location, its facilities for the price you pay and its staff very much reflected mine. OK so you are staying on the Grand Canal and there will be some canal noises - emergency services etc which cannot be helped - but this hotel is ideally placed, has wonderfully obliging staff, has the standard facilities of a hotel in its class and really cares about its guests (I suppose as long as they show the same respect and concern in return). Santa Chiara I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible end to a lovely trip!!”
Reviews.Author: WANDERINGFIL
Reviews.Content: Apart from the below-average (at best!) room I was given, the morning clerk gave us such bad information about the early morning airport bus that we missed it! This is a hotel that does much of it's trade due to its location next to the bus stop - which should be ideal for getting to the airport in the morning. You would think that they would know the general bus schedule! First he said it was the yellow bus at 5AM (which he then admitted was the one that "just left" at 4:45) and then he said it was the blue bus on the other side of the Piazzale -- too late by then! :( I got to the plane in tears after flagging down a delightful off-duty cab driver who took pity on us and ran every red light on the way to VCE! That being said (warning to early departing guests!!), the tired room was nothing like the hotel's description and the beautiful photo of the hotel by the Grand Canal must have been carefully taken to avoid the real bustling commercial nature of this location. After a wonderful trip to my favorite city the Santa Chiara left us all feeling so stressed and unhappy!

Reviews.Title: “A great place in to stay in Venice if you arrive by car”
Reviews.Author: akl211
Reviews.Content: Our party of four spent two nights in the Santa Chiara in June 2008 on our way by car to Rome. Although initially somewhat apprehensive, we were delighted with the location. And we were thrilled to have our car parked (albeit at 20 Euros a day) in the very adjacent hotel car park. It's a lovely old building with comfortable rooms, some with a great view over the canal and its vibrant activity. The desk staff were extremely friendly and efficient and gave great advice on where to eat both evenings. It's very near the main Grand Canal vaporetto station as well as the railway station and bus terminal. The bustling university area, where we saw as many students as tourists, was within easy walking distance. It's not cheap. What is in Venice? But it's an ideal place to stay for those not arriving by air,

Reviews.Title: “Bait & Switch at the Santa Chiara”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerTom
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were told that the only room left in the hotel had no air-conditioning ("broken") and so we would be taken to someplace called the "Residence Parisi" which was "nearby." I did not really understand what this meant until our luggage was dragged by a porter to a nasty-looking office building literally adjacent to the crowded vaporetto stop, and only accessible thru a locked iron gate and a locked front door down a deserted alleyway. There was a small signboard at the end of the alley with a sign indicating the name of the building. Other than that it looked like the offices next door. It turns out the room key fob had separate keys for all of these much-needed security measures!) Inside, the lobby had no lighting until you were actually inside, when a motion sensor turned on a security lamp. If someone had been waiting inside, you would have been easy prey! This was true even at night! When we got to the room it turned out that the key fob also had an electronic device which had to be plugged into a socket in the wall to turn on any lighting at all -- a terrible arrangement in the day, and impossible to manage with no lights at night! We had to stand in the dark and fumble to shove this thing into a little hole in order to see where we were going. Unfortunately when the lights did go on, they revealed a largish shabby room with two chairs, a desk and a "platform" bed with minimally acceptable linens and totally unacceptable foam mattresses --- overall the look and comfort of a quickly thrown together set of tag-sale furniture. The bathroom completed the impression, as it had all the charm and utility of a hospital operating suite -- one large room with an open shower at the end (with no divider from the toilet next to it) and a minimal sink at the other. The building, the lack of any sense of safety, and the horrific accommodations all bore no resemblance whatever to either the description in the Santa Chiara literature nor any photographs shown on the hotel web site. This is because we were sent to someplace other than the place we booked and paid for. When we first got to the room I immediately called the front desk and said that this was not the room I had booked, and not even in the Santa Chiara hotel. I asked to be switched back to the room in the hotel, even without air conditioning. The desk manager told me that this was the room he had for us, and that there were no refunds and likely no other hotels available, given that there was a festival that night in Venice. I told him that I had booked a room at the Santa Chiara (which at least was an historic building fronting on the grand canal) not at the shabby Parisi. He said we should be happy that the room was larger and had A/C. He further stated that this room switch was standard practice at the hotel. My daughter and I thus had no other option but to be victims of this bait and switch policy, as described by the unpleasant manager. We decided to brave the drunken revelers, grab a quick bite, and be certain to arrive back at the Parisi before nightfall, when opening the iron gate would surely be an invitation to the milling crowd. When we left for our 5:00 AM bus to the airport, we had to step over sleeping partiers and be accosted by people wanting money on our way across the piazza to return the key and check out. I once again strenuously objected to the hotel tactics, but at least felt safer being in the lobby of the 3 star hotel we had been charged for! While I did not (obviously) see a room in the Hotel, the atmosphere was decidedly nicer than what we had to endure. In sum, I booked a room at the 3-star Santa Chiara Hotel, based on the pictures, descriptions and location advertised by the hotel. We were given completely different, lesser and unacceptable accommodations and held "hostage" by the management who treated our every request with seemingly delighted scorn. If I had known what our room was to be like prior to booking it, I would definitely have stayed elsewhere. This was unequivocally the worst hotel experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Respone to hotel manager”
Reviews.Author: MontrealBubbalicious
Reviews.Content: Hello Mr. Manager, As a prospective customer who will be in Venice in early September and who is researching hotels at the moment, I am truly put off by your past two responses to the reviews previously outline. Your response is borderline rude as if to say that your hotel staff was in no way disrespectful. You dont know that for sure and you offer no apologies except to say that your customers were wrong. With that attitudue, I will certainly not stay at your cheezy hotel as I already know the service you and your staff delivers. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bengalcatlover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Residenza Parisi. We found it a little curious at first when we were escorted over to a whole different building from the Santa Chiara but it ended up being very nice. The room itself was a decent size and the bathroom was enormous. Our "king" size bed was actually two twin beds pushed up next to each other but it was okay. The room was clean which is the most important thing to me. The breakfast was nice. Meats, cheese, fruit, bread, cereal, pastries. There is a small bar area. I found the staff to be overall helpful and considerate. No complaints there. We loved the location of this hotel. We were able to walk there and find it very easily from the train terminal. Both buildings are very very near the Water Bus terminal so it's super convenient if you use the boats. It was also right by the buses. It was so easy for us to hop on a bus and get to the airport when we left. Such a great location. Venice is very small and easy to get around in. We walked everywhere we went while there. Except for our gondola ride of course. It was not a problem to walk all the way to St. Marks Square. We just loved walking around Venice in general. We never had a problem finding our way back to the hotel. Overall I would definitely stay here again since it was so easy and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not for female travlers.”
Reviews.Author: Brettashly
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel through Ryan Air's website, it did not say anything about an alternate location. We arrived at the hotel and were told our rooms were in an annex. The porter ran ahead of us to the rooms, I guess because it was raining, we had to walk through the bus station where we were harassed by several people. Then the porter did not show us which of the 3 keys we needed to open which doors (there were three), dropped my bag in a puddle and then demanded a tip. I felt obliged to tip him because of the remoteness of the annex, and felt afraid of what he might do if I did not tip him. I did not report this to the front desk because the clerk seemed unfriendly and was unsure if he would rectify the situation. I would not stay here as a single female. Also we were put in a handicapped room that was very awkward, no shower curtain and a very high toilet seat. Housekeeping did an excellent job, the hotel was near a vaporetta stop, and the breakfast was good, but a long walk in the rain to the main hotel where it was served.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: LindaSeattle
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at Hotel Santa Chiara. It is located right across the street from the bus line.= and just a ways from the train station. Our room had a gorgeous view of the canal. The room was very spacious. The beds were comfortable and the room was quiet. The staff were very professional. There is internet access for a fee. The breakfast buffet was quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying there”
Reviews.Author: oxxygen
Reviews.Content: Good location, good staff, convenient room. Close to the train station. Very nice building, especially its outside view. Reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “unwelcoming”
Reviews.Author: MemberK
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well situated, near the bus and vaporetto stations, on the Grand Canal. Staff were pretty unwelcoming and distinctly unhelpful after our check in experieince. We booked online and paid extra for a room described as canal view with balcony. There was no balcony and we were told the supplement was just to request a room with a balcony (there is only one in the hotel, full of course) but jolly nice chaps that they were, they had given us a canal view room as though it were a great concession and personal favour. After that we felt very let down, taken for fools and they barely acknowledged us again. During our stay this filtered down through the entire staff team and we spent very little time at the hotel, trying to be very low key to minimise our embarassment at being conspicuously ignored. At times it was very uncomfortable. The room did have a canal view, was clean and big enough. It was pretty worn and tired e.g. the bedspread had a big frayed hole in it, the toilet seat was broken, nothing truly major. The shower arrangements sent water everywhere, not the best.. Breakfast was fine, though orange juice, milk for cereal and coffee were all items for which we had to request (though these requests were free of charge!) and wait (and wait and then wait some more) though the view from the breakfast room was a bit stunning. This hotel experience could have put a real downer on the whole holiday but Venice is so lovely we couldn't help but have a good time. It would have been a fabulous time had we had a good experience with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JoanGermantown
Reviews.Content: The Santa Chiara is in close proximity to the busline, so easy to find and a great starting point for excursions. The staff was polite but not very friendly. The breakfast in the hotel was very nice and they have great American style coffee. My biggest concern was that we were taken to the Residenza Parisi. We walked from the very impressive looking Hotel, back past the vaporetto stop and kept going another block without anyone saying anything to us about it. We walked down an alley and entered the Residenza and we were on the first floor looking out onto an alley, and the room was dark and cheaply furnished, and the beds were twins pushed together. To go to breakfast or talk to any staff you had to walk back to the Hotel. We requested a room in the hotel but they stated they had no vacancies. I did go through a website for a package deal, but the reservation was for the HOTEL, not the Residenza. I think they need to make that clear on their website because otherwise you feel like you just experienced a bait and switch. Just because they own both sites does not mean they are the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !!”
Reviews.Author: at_doha
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in extended room, approx. 100 m from original hotel location. Eventhough we have only stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, during July 2007, the room is nice, clean, and pretty big for us with 2 teenagers. Both room and bathroom were pretty big, and the location is great! A few steps from Vaporetto stop and just a short walking distance from Saint Mark Square. Hotel staff were very friendly, they gave us a lot of very useful informations and suggestions regarding tours, restaurants and directions. Choices of breakfast is good, and the waiter was very professional, a very nice guy. We will come here again for our next trip here in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay for tourist”
Reviews.Author: ramblingman77
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with english speaking staff. Hotel was very clean with basic immenities to include a room safe. size fit the standard "european" steriotype. Breakfast buffet(free) was beyond expectations. AUality meats, selection, etc. Hotel could use some minor renovations, but this could be written off as "charm". My room door did stick and took me an hour to get out, and at that point, I was not real happy with the charm. Secured parking, but since you are at the canal, the cost was worth it. (24 euro). It was a great feeling to pull into an area which was swamped with buses with people coming into Venice, and you could jus drive into the hotel. If you are driving, this hotel is a must. I had good feeling when other where either commuting or dragging their baggage onto water taxis and roaming aimlessly looking for thier hotel in Venice. Room was comfortable, but was actually smaller than most singles.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Very friendly and kind staff”
Reviews.Author: skyline1312
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Santa Chiara for 4 nights, during October 2007. This wasn't our first trip in Italy, we already visited Rome and Florence a couple of years ago, but it was our very first time in Venice! The hotel is very well keeped, very charming and clean. Our room was overlooking the small Canal (Rio Nuovo), we wanted a Room with the Grand Canal View but these guys were already fully booked. Both room and bathroom were pretty big, and the view was really really nice. The location is great! Easily reacheble from the airport, a few steps from Vaporetto stop and just a 30 minutes of walking distance from Saint Mark's Square. The guys at the reception were very friendly, they gave us a lot of very usefull informations and suggestions regarding tours, restaurants and directions. Also the waiter who served us in the morning during the breakfast was very professional, a very nice guy. Definitely we will come here again for our next trip here in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Advice from the Staff and Owner”
Reviews.Author: MommyH63
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. It was a good location but the photo's on the website are decieving. The shower in our room backed up everytime we used it. We told them about the problem but nobody ever came to fix it so the floor in our bath was always wet. We asked about a Gondala ride on our first night and they told us it was too late, so we walked down the Grand Canal and there were Gondala's all along the river.The second day we asked about going to Murano. They said they have a free private boat ride to the Island. The owner came on the boat with us. When we got there they took us to Vetreria Gritti Art Glass shop. We were pressured to buy an expensive piece of glass art. They said it would be sighed by the artist and shipped for free. When we got it we were charged for shipping and signed by the wrong artist. We don't even think it was the right piece. They wouldn't let us look at any other shops. We were rushed to get back on the boat or else we would have to rent one ourselves to get back to the hotel. I'm sure the hotel owner got a commission. On our last day we asked when to get the bus back to the Airport and they told us the wrong time. We almost missed the bus. Bad experience. Venice is Beautiful.
